DOC.HEAD: Hijackers Do Their Own Driving, But Pay Their Fare
DOC.TEXT: Three people flagged down a cab, forced the driver out and drove off, but at least they paid the fare. Ken Sharp said that when police returned his cab to him Thursday, the hijackers had left $96 in the door pocket, including his change money and ``the 20 pound ($32) fare I'd asked for when they first got in.'' The 33-year-old man's cab was hijacked Wednesday and left by the side of the road near Torquay, 150 miles southwest of London. Police on Thursday returned the taxi, found 25 miles away in Plymouth. ``Finding the money was surprising,'' said a police spokesman. ``It must be the Christmas spirit.''
